intro: Sideroxylon dubium, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hard, dense wood, which is highly valued for its durability. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often elliptical in shape, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sideroxylon dubium is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
